entries.name: Awkward
entries: This weapon requires additional training to use properly, but you still get limited use with it. You do not add your proficiency bonus while rolling an attack with this weapon.

entries.name: Conceal
entries: You gain advantage on Sleight of Hand Checks made to conceal the weapon on your person. If it is discovered, some conceal weapons still require the searching party makes a successful Intelligence check to identify what it is.

entries.name: Brace
entries: As an Action you choose to Brace. On your turn, choose any targets you can see that are at least 20 feet away from you. If any one of those targets move within your weapon’s reach before your next turn, you can make one melee attack against it with your weapon, which uses your reaction. If the attack hits, treat the attack as a critical hit. While bracing, you cannot use a reaction. While bracing, if you move or are moved against your will, you forfeit the reaction until your next turn. A brace attack is not an Opportunity Attack.

entries.name: Deflect
entries: If struck by a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to roll your weapon’s damage plus your strength modifier, then subtract that total from the damage dealt to you for one attack. If you are dual wielding deflect weapons, you may do this to two attacks using the same reaction.

entries.name: Disarm
entries: You may only make a disarm attempt with weapons that have the Disarm property, unless you have an ability that says otherwise. On hit, you can choose to deal only your Strength modifier in damage and force your enemy to roll a Strength or Dexterity Saving Throw. On a failure, it drops one held object of your choice, landing within 5ft of it. If the enemy is larger than you or is using a two-handed weapon, it gains advantage on this save. If it is smaller than you, it suffers disadvantage. Shields that are strapped to the arm are immune to Disarm.

entries.name: Double Ended
entries: You make one additional attack as a bonus action (or part of the attack action, see: Best Practices) using the damage listed, if you are within 5 ft of your target and wielding your weapon with two hands. Double Ended attacks do not benefit from Reach.

entries.name: Entangle
entries: On hit, you can choose to deal only your Strength modifier in damage and force the enemy to succeed on a Strength or Dexterity Saving Throw or be grappled. To escape, the entangled target must succeed a grapple check against your weapon DC, gaining advantage if it is larger than you. Creatures two size categories larger than you are immune to being entangled. While you are holding the weapon entangling your target, your attacks only damage equal to your Strength modifier. You may also interact with your target as if you were grappling it, for example, moving it or shoving it. You can release a foe from being entangled at any time. If you drop the weapon, the foe is automatically freed.

entries.name: Firearm
entries: Rolling a 1 on an Attack Roll causes this weapon to jam. It's still loaded, but a malfunction prevented ignition. As an action, you must clear the jam before it can make a ranged attack again. Firearm weapons can't make ranged attacks underwater, and if they are subjected to water such as from rain or a tidal wave spell, they jam on a 1-2 until you spend an action to dry them. All firearms create a sound which can be heard up to 300ft away. Firearm weapons that have the Ranged property require gun powder and either, lead ball, bullet, or shot loaded into it to make an attack. Ammunition is not recoverable from Firearm weapons. Firearm weapons that have the Launch property can be recovered if they fail to go off due to a jam (meaning the weapon was thrown, but did not explode when it landed).

entries.name: Launch
entries: If you miss, this weapon lands on the ground but still goes off within 5ft of the intended target. Roll a d8. The result is which square it lands in, starting with the square closest to you as 1, and counting clockwise until you reach the rolled number.

entries.name: Lunge
entries: If you use an attack action, you attack a foe up to 5ft further than normal with all attacks for that turn, which can be combined with Reach. This ends with your turn and cannot be used as part of an Opportunity Attack. Performing a lunge uses your reaction.

entries.name: Penetrate
entries: These weapons are designed to penetrate armor and deal more damage to those wearing it. While attacking an enemy using a shield or wearing heavy armor, you can roll totale damage from your weapon twice and take the better result.

entries.name: Trip
entries: If your attack is successful, you can choose to deal only your Strength modifier in damage and your enemy must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity Saving Throw or be knocked prone. Enemies 1 size category larger than you gain advantage on this save. Enemies two size categories larger than you are immune to being tripped in this way.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: You have advantage on opportunity attacks made with this weapon. Additionally, if this weapon is in your off hand, you may make an opportunity attack with your main hand and this weapon.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Allows you to wield the weapon with one hand, and gives the Lunge property. When your attack is successful, as a Bonus Action, you can choose to force the enemy to succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10ft toward you.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery gives the light property, and the damage scales with proficiency, d4, d6, d8, and d10 for +2, +3, +5, and +6 respectively. As a reaction to a melee attack, before the roll, you can declare that you try to catch the attack. If the attack misses, you have advantage on your next weapon attack, athletics, or acrobatics check against that enemy, or you can give disadvantage to these checks your enemy makes on their next turn, unless they let go of their weapon.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Any hit against a surprised creature takes maximum damage from this weapon and any modifiers such as sneak attack, instead of rolling for the damage.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery gains the Disarm, Entangle, and Trip properties. The deflect die is 1d8. You may use the Deflect property against flight weapons. When a creature you can see attacks a target that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: When you score a critical hit, make an additional melee attack to another creature adjacent to you as part of the same action.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery grants the Trip property, and 1d8 damage. Your deflect roll is 2d10, rather than d8, and you may add your proficiency to this roll.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery gives the Deflect, Disarm, Light, and Trip properties, and the damage scales with proficiency, d4, d6, d8, and d10 for +2, +3, +5, and +6 respectively. You may use your bonus action to perform a shove or disarm attack.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery makes the damage 1d10 or 1d12 two handed. Reroll a damage dice result of 1 or 2.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery makes damage 2d8. When you roll at least 5 higher than the enemy's AC, you can roll all damage and any modifiers twice and take the better result.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery gives the Entangle property, and makes the damage 3d4. You gain advantage on trip attacks made to mounted enemies and Large creautres. If your trip is successful against a mounted foe, it is automatically pulled from its mount to a prone position. You gain advantage on entangle attacks made against enemies two size categories larger than you.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery gives the Disarm property. You gain advantage on all disarm attacks.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery gives the Light, Entangle, and Lunge properties. When you are hit with a melee weapon attack, as a reaction you can make a disarm or entangle attack against that enemy. While dual wielding two hook swords, you have reach and a lunge does not use your reaction.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: When you make a trip attack, if you hit, even if they save against the attempt, your enemy's speed is reduced by 10ft until the end of their next turn. While they have this penalty, they have disadvantage saving throws against a trip attack.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery increases damage to 2d6. While wielding a poleaxe, you gain +1 AC and you may add your proficiency bonus to deflect rolls.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery gives the Disarm property. You can choose to take a -5 penalty to a ranged attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery grants the Deflect property, and increases the damage to 1d10. If you are successful in a disarm attempt, the enemy can no longer add proficiency to attacks with that weapon.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery grants the versatile property, and increases the damage to 1d8 and the two handed damage to 1d10. The thrown range increases to 20 and 40. When you score a critical hit, your enemy is stunned for d4 rounds. At the end of each of its turns, your stunned enemy can attempt a Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery increases damage to 1d6. On hit, you can choose to deal only your Strength modifier in damage but your foe must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer disadvantage to its Saving Throws until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery grants the Deflect property. If you successfully Disarm, your enemy has disadvantage on melee attacks. At the end of its turn, it can attempt a Constitution saving throw, ending this effect on a success. You can apply this effect to any creature on success regardless of if it is wielding a weapon.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery increases the damage to 1d8. Your penetrate affects creatures in any armor. You may also add your strength modifier twice to Penetrate damage totals.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery increases the range to 30 and 90. As a bonus action, you can make a shove attempt that, if successful, deals bludgeoning damage equal to your strength modifier.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery gives the Double Ended property, with the damage being 1d4, and increases the main weapon damage to 1d12. Before you roll an attack, you can choose to -5 to the roll. On hit, you deal piercing damage equal to your strength modifier, but reduce the enemy's AC by the same amount.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: The Double Ended property damage is 1d6. Mastery increases the Double Ended damage to 1d8. You gain +1 AC while wielding this weapon and you may add your ability modifier to damage rolls made with Double Ended. Additionally, you may use Double Ended when making an Opportunity Attack, making two attacks instead of one.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Melee damage is 1d6, ranged is 1d8. Mastery gives the Double Ended property, for 1d6 damage. You may add your ability modifier to damage rolls made with Double Ended.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Martial reload is a free object interaction. Mastery makes the damage 1d12, and the reload part of the attack. When you overdraw, you take the normal -5 to attack, but if you hit, you deal damage to your primary target, and one other target in a straight line from you that intercects your first target.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery increases damage to 1d12. When you score a critical hit, your enemy must succeed on a strength saving throw or be shoved 5ft in a straight line away from you and knocked prone. Large creatures have advantage on this save, and larger creatures are immune. Creatures that are flying have disadvantage on this save.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery increases damage to 1d10. If you suffer disadvantage for any reason, you can use your reaction to attempt a concentration check against DC10 or half your target's AC, whichever is higher. If you succeed, your disadvantage is negated.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: You can loose two arrows at the same time, shooting one target with two attacks or two targets with one attack each. These attacks suffer disadvantage.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery increases damage to 1d8. You threaten 5ft around you and can make a ranged opportunity attack when an enemy leaves your threatened space. You do not have disadvantage to ranged attacks if an enemy is within 5ft of you.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery increases damage to 1d6, and gives the Entangle, Melee 1d6, Light, and Trip properties. You can take -5 to the attack roll to hurl with extra strength, and on hit, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage to attacks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: You can measure distance from yourself to a single DM approved obstacle, and then to your target. If that range is within your long distance, you can ignore any cover the enemy has. You can bounce twice, but this attack is made with disadvantage.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: You can use a bonus action to make an attack with a dagger, even if you don't take the attack action.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery adds the Disarm property, and increases the range to 40/120. Reroll any damage die from this weapon or any modifiers that rolls a 1. Additionally, when you trip, your target's speed is reduced by 10ft until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery gives the Deflect, Light, and Lunge properties. If you are wielding a rapier and nothing in your off hand, you can add d4 to your damage roll. If you are wielding a light weapon, instead add +1 to AC.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Melee damage increased to 2d4, and adds the Deflect and Light properties. If an enemy hits you with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency to your AC, possibly negating a successful hit. This added bonus to AC lasts for that enemy's turn only.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery grants the Disarm property. You gain +1 AC if you are wielding a Sai in your off hand. As a bonus action you may make a disarm attack.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery makes the damage 1d8. When you have advantage on the attack, you can roll damage twice and take the better result, including any modifiers attached to the shortsword, such as elemental imbue damage or sneak attacks.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery makes the damage 1d6, and grants the Entangle property. Your entangle attacks deal full weapon damage on hit. When you hit with a trip attack, your enemy suffers -10 ft to its speed until the end of its next turn, regardless of if it succeeds on the save against the trip.

entries.name: Mastery Perk
entries: Mastery grants the Lunge property. If you have advantage on your attack, you may add d4 to your attack roll. If you have disadvantage on your attack, you may spend your bonus action to roll your choice of athletics or acrobatics to negate the disadvantage. The DC is equal to your targets AC.
